title: 820-2838 no audio
message: Hi in this card I encountered a strange problem, as OS X audio output gives me the headphone jack alone, I don't understand what the problem is and where to start, I just did the pram reset

title: 820-2838 no audio
message:
You always get headphones, no speaker available?
Change LIO board; audio codec is there.

Very likely bad headphones connector.
You can try to clean it first, or replace.

title: 820-2838 no audio
message:
I also tried to change the LIO 
board to another is another flex but the result is the same.
The boot sound does

title: 820-2838 no audio
message:
Boot sound (chime) is not related with audio codec.
However, LIO board is required.

Headphones/speakers detection is done by audio codec, in base of signals from audio connector; both placed on LIO board.

"You always get headphones, no speaker available?"
???

title: 820-2838 no audio
message: Yes, just the headphones nothing else

title: 820-2838 no audio
message:
No reaction on System Prefferences -> Sound -> Output, when connect/disconnect headphones?

As I said, audio codec is in charge of detection.
The problem should be solved changing LIO board...

title: 820-2838 no audio
message: With the preferences open I tried to disconnect and reconnect but nothing remains unchanged this with two different lio tabs

title: 820-2838 no audio
message:
Check the level of AUD_IP_PERIPHERAL_DET w/ and w/o headphones inserted.
Be sure to have good solders on its pin at J4700.
If no change, check R1781.

title: 820-2838 no audio
message: I measured AUD_IP_PERIPHERAL_DET with the 4.5V mi inserted headphones and with the headphones not inserted 3.0V but the system shows me only the earbuds as output

title: 820-2838 no audio
message:
Did you try correct LIO board?
Changed the LIO flex too?

That signal is pulled-up to 3.3V; shouldn't get there 4.5V ever.

title: 820-2838 no audio
message: So I have to understand why when I insert the jack it reaches 4.5V which by the way must remain at 3.3 right?

title: 820-2838 no audio
message:
Not sure about that.
On 820-3115, that signal is pulled-up to 4.5V; switches 0<->4.5V, depending if headphones (or SPDIF) is inserted.
Strange that on this Air board is pulled-up to 3.3V...

Audio codec expects another signal from the audio connector, to know if headphones, or speakers must be used as output.
